media.caption: Whitney Houston performing on her My Love is Your Love Tour in Hamburg.

text.headline:
Whitney Houston
1963 - 2012
text.text: Houston's voice caught the imagination of the world propelling her to superstardom at an early age becoming one of the most awarded performers of our time. This is a look into the amazing heights she achieved and her personal struggles with substance abuse and a tumultuous marriage.

media.caption: Portrait of Louis XIV
media.credit: Artist: Hyacinthe Rigaud via Wikimedia Commons

text.headline: Reign of Louis XIV Begins
text.text: The reign of Louis XIV, also known as the Sun King, began on May 14, 1643, and lasted until his death in 1715, marking a significant period of French history characterized by absolutist monarchy.

media.caption: French Revolutionary Wars
media.credit: Artist: Hippolyte Bellangé via Wikimedia Commons

text.headline: French Revolutionary Wars Begin
text.text: The French Revolutionary Wars commenced on April 20, 1792, marking a significant period of conflict between revolutionary France and various European powers.

media.caption: Storming of the Bastille
media.credit: Artist: Jean-Pierre Houël via Wikimedia Commons

text.headline: Storming of the Bastille
text.text: The storming of the Bastille on July 14, 1789, marked a pivotal moment in the French Revolution, symbolizing the start of the overthrow of the monarchy.

media.caption: Proclamation of the Third French Republic
media.credit: Artist: Henri Felix Emmanuel Philippoteaux via Wikimedia Commons

text.headline: Proclamation of the Third French Republic
text.text: The Third French Republic was proclaimed on September 4, 1870, following the collapse of the Second Empire after France's defeat in the Franco-Prussian War.

media.caption: Signing of the Treaty of Versailles
media.credit: Artist: Unknown author via Wikimedia Commons

text.headline: Treaty of Versailles Signed
text.text: The Treaty of Versailles was signed on June 28, 1919, officially ending World War I and imposing heavy penalties on Germany.

media.caption: Charles de Gaulle
media.credit: Artist: Unknown author via Wikimedia Commons

text.headline: Charles de Gaulle's Appeal
text.text: On June 18, 1940, Charles de Gaulle, leader of the Free French Forces, made a broadcast urging the French to resist the German occupation during World War II.

media.caption: Signing of the Treaty of Paris
media.credit: Artist: Benjamin West via Wikimedia Commons

text.headline: Treaty of Paris Signed
text.text: The Treaty of Paris was signed on September 3, 1783, formally ending the American Revolutionary War and recognizing the independence of the United States from Great Britain.

media.caption: Portrait of Napoleon Bonaparte
media.credit: Artist: François Gérard via Wikimedia Commons

text.headline: Napoleon Bonaparte Crowned Emperor
text.text: Napoleon Bonaparte was crowned Emperor of the French on May 18, 1804, establishing the First French Empire.

media.caption: Eiffel Tower
media.credit: Photographer: Benh LIEU SONG via Wikimedia Commons

text.headline: Eiffel Tower Inaugurated
text.text: The Eiffel Tower, an iconic symbol of France, was inaugurated on March 31, 1889, and has since become a global architectural marvel.

text.headline: Liberation of Paris
text.text: The Liberation of Paris began on August 25, 1944, as the French Forces of the Interior and the Allies liberated the city from German occupation during World War II.
